feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...POTENTIAL MARINE LAYER FOLLOWED BY WARMER THAN NORMAL TEMPERATURES HEADING INTO NEXT WEEK... Warmer than normal temperatures are expected by late this weekend as temperatures rise by a couple degrees each day. The warmest days are expected to be early next week with highs in the mid 70s and continued dry conditions.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT WAVE NEXT WEEK... Temperatures will soar starting late this weekend into mid next week across the northern and central Inner Channels. A few temperature records could fall. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...VERY WARM NEXT WEEK... Temperatures will soar this weekend with highs up to 75 to 85 degrees. The warmest days are expected to be Monday through Wednesday.
